summary: Bilingual Domestic Violence Advocate with experience providing crisis intervention, risk assessment, safety planning, and supportive counseling to a caseload of approximately 30 clients. Proficient with EPIC, electronic medical records, and data systems (ETO); working knowledge of SAS and R. Experienced in trauma-informed care, program development, and presenting on gender identity.

experience.title: Bilingual Domestic Violence Advocate
experience.description: Provided advocacy services to a caseload of approximately 30 clients, including crisis intervention, risk assessment, safety planning, supportive counseling, and assistance accessing community resources. On-call service one to two times a week; first responder for intimate partner violence referrals from hospital and self-referrals from the community. Documented in Passageway database (ETO) and EPIC; utilized clinical strategies; provided psycho-educational resources; worked with clients on coping skills and behaviors. Developed and led a presentation on gender identity; participated in Brigham and Women's Hospital Schwartz Rounds.

experience.title: Intern
experience.description: Assessed mental health, physical health, and supportive services needs of up to ten children and families per week via biopsychosocial assessments. Collaborated to provide trauma-informed care; engaged families in strengths-based relationships; referred to local mental health agencies, community programs, and government organizations. Conducted weekly pediatric mental health screenings; participated in weekly meetings and monthly pediatric team meetings; developed and led a presentation on youth and self-harm.

experience.title: Corps Member, City Year
experience.description: Mentored and tutored 7th grade students; referred students to counselors; collaborated to aid trauma symptoms, behavior, academic performance, and quality of life. Engaged with families to discuss behavior and mental health; created extracurricular behavior programming; five students met goals; directed a High School Fair with attendance from eight local schools and roughly 80 parents and students.

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.description: Collected, transcribed, and coded interviews with parents and children on animal behavior and evolution. Analyzed data to measure understanding of evolution; contributed to a research paper: Shtulman, A., & Checa, I. (2012).

education.degree: Master of Public Health, Epidemiology, Maternal and Child Health
Master of Social Work, Clinical Social Work
